text: John J. "Jack" Lanigan (February 9, 1935 – October 11, 2014) was an American businessman and politician. Born in Chicago, Illinois, Lanigan went to Chicago Vocational High School. He then received his bachelor's degree in accounting from DePaul University. Lanigan served briefly in the Illinois Air National Guard. He worked in the savings and loan business. From 1965 to 1971, Lanigan served in the Illinois State Senate and was a Republican. Later, Lanigan served as Illinois State Savings and Loan Commissioner and on the Illinois State Board of Election. Lanigan died at a hospital in Oak Lawn, Illinois.'Former state Sen. John J. Lanigan dies,' Chicago Tribune, Bob Goldsborough, November 14, 2014'Illinois Blue Book 1969–1970,' Biographical Sketch of John J. Lanigan, pg. 166–167 ==Notes== Category:1935 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:DePaul University alumni Category:Businesspeople from Illinois Category:Military personnel from Illinois Category:Illinois Republicans Category:Illinois state senators
title: John J. Lanigan
